title.narrative: Emergency WASH Response for Western Mosul

description.narrative: The proposed project will complement Oxfam's Mosul response interventions and will enable Oxfam to provide first line and second line WASH response targeting IDPs, returnees and critically affected host communities in newly accessible and hard to reach areas in western Mosul and its surrounding. Oxfam will provide comprehensive WASH services through provision of adequate safe and clean water, rehabilitation of existing water system/treatment plants that has been severely damaged during the conflict, establishment emergency surface water treatment plant with distribution points to support water trucking, extension of water distribution networks where possible, construction of emergency latrines amp bathing facilities, WASH in public buildings (PHCs amp schools), solid waste management, provision of appropriate hygiene education and materials including female specific hygiene items, commodes amp adult diapers for PWDs and water storage containers, and promotion of household water treatment prioritizing the most vulnerable households targeting women, men, girls amp boys. The specific interventions related to SWAT (surface water treatment) Installation include operation and maintenance and also train the SWAT operators and other WTP operators in basic operation and maintenance before they are handed to directorate of water. The SWAT would treat water during the period of emergency and in consultation with WASH Cluster, SWAT will be accessible by other WASH partners that will be involve in the water trucking within Mosul and its surroundings. In addition Oxfam will rehabilitate/construct WASH facilities in 6 public buildings (PHCs, schools) to improve the poor hygienic condition in the targeted institutions which arise due to damage/lack of WASH facilities. The work will include rehabilitation/construction of latrines, water points, solid waste management and medical waste management. Oxfam will conduct hygiene sessions along with the water and sanitation activities put in place through a trained group of hygiene promoters on basic hygiene promotion in emergencies and community mobilization. Child - to - Child Approach targeting hygiene activities in schools and within the entire areas of response will be conducted to support the psychosocial needs of children affected by the conflict through interactive ways. To mitigate risks to vector borne diseases resulting from poor waste management practices, Oxfam will mobilize community to participate in management of solid waste through clean up campaigns organized together with local authorities and the municipality. Oxfam will also provide the most vulnerable households with hygiene kits which will include water storage and collection containers, soap, ibriks, laundry detergent, female dignity materials among others. Oxfam will adhere to the national WASH cluster standards and NFI guidelines for all WASH intervention. Oxfam will work closely with directorate of water, health, education, WASH cluster and other WASH actors to ensure coherent response amp avoid duplication of efforts and resources. As an exit strategy Oxfam will consult with DOW and will hand over the water systems/water treatment plants to DOW.
